ftbbackups3.general.auto.tooltip: Run backups automatically, based on the "Backup Timer" setting
ftbbackups3.general.silent.tooltip: If true, online players are not notified when a backup runs
ftbbackups3.general.backups_to_keep.tool:
Number of backup ZIP files to keep.
Oldest ZIP file will be deleted when a backup runs
ftbbackups3.general.backup_timer.tooltip: Frequency, in minutes, to run backups, when "Automatic Backups" is true
ftbbackups3.general.compression_level.to:
File compression level for backups
9 = maximum compression
1 = minimum compression
0 = don't create a ZIP file, just copy the world folder
ftbbackups3.general.folder.tooltip:
If not empty, an absolute path to the backup folder
If empty, backups are placed in the "backups" folder in your game instance
ftbbackups3.general.display_file_size.to: When true (and "Run Silently" is false), also display backed-up file size to players
ftbbackups3.general.extra_files.tooltip:
By default, just the files in the world folder are backed up
This can be used to add extra files from outside the world folder to the backup
World folder is "world" on a dedicated server,
 and "saves/<worldname>" on a single-player instance
ftbbackups3.general.max_total_size.toolt:
The maximum size to allow for backups.
Oldest backups will be deleted to keep the total backup size under this amount
Valid suffixes: KB, MB, GB, TB
ftbbackups3.general.only_if_players_onli: Automated backups are only run if at least one player is online
ftbbackups3.general.force_on_shutdown.to: If true (and "Automatic Backups" is true), always run a backup when the server is being stopped
ftbbackups3.general.advanced.buffer_size:
Buffer size used when reading files to be backed up.
Don't adjust this unless you understand the implications!
